variants.Description in input context: Pathogenic C-terminal and N-terminal parkin mutants. C-terminal deletion causes loss of membrane association and misfolding; N-terminal mutations in the UBL domain reduce stability, leading to proteasomal degradation.

Material used.Material Source: Cell line and human brain tissue
Material used.Description: Mutants were characterized using cultured cells and human brain extracts. The 42 kDa parkin species was identified in these samples.

Readout description.Molecular Effect: Loss of membrane association and misfolding (C-terminal deletion); proteasomal degradation (N-terminal mutations)
Readout description.Result Description: C-terminal deletion leads to loss of membrane association and misfolding; N-terminal mutations reduce stability, resulting in proteasomal degradation. The 42 kDa parkin species lacks the UBL domain.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Protein expression greater than 80% on day 7 (custom standard)

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Protein expression less than 50% on day 7 (custom standard)
